verses.verse: Now when Rachel <WH7354> saw <WH7200> that she bore <WH3205> Jacob <WH3290> no <WH3808> children, she became <WH7065> jealous <WH7065> of her sister; <WH269> and she said <WH559> to Jacob, <WH3290> "Give <WH3051> me children, <WH1121> or else <WH518> <WH369> I die. <WH4191>"

Then Jacob's anger <WH639> burned <WH2734> against Rachel, <WH7354> and he said, <WH559> "Am I in the place <WH8478> of God, <WH430> who <WH834> has withheld <WH4513> from you the fruit <WH6529> of the womb <WH990>?"

And she said, <WH559> "Here <WH2009> is my maid <WH519> Bilhah, <WH1090> go <WH935> in to her, that she may bear <WH3205> on my knees, <WH1290> that through <WH4480> her I too <WH1571> may have <WH1129> children. <WH1129>"
So she gave <WH5414> him her maid <WH8198> Bilhah <WH1090> as a wife, <WH802> and Jacob <WH3290> went <WH935> in to her.
And Bilhah <WH1090> conceived <WH2029> and bore <WH3205> Jacob <WH3290> a son. <WH1121>

Then Rachel <WH7354> said, <WH559> "God <WH430> has vindicated <WH1777> me, and has indeed <WH1571> heard <WH8085> my voice <WH6963> and has given <WH5414> me a son. <WH1121>" Therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> she named <WH7121> <WH8034> him Dan. <WH1835>
And Rachel's maid <WH8198> Bilhah <WH1090> conceived <WH2029> again <WH5750> and bore <WH3205> Jacob <WH3290> a second <WH8145> son. <WH1121>

So Rachel <WH7354> said, <WH559> "With mighty <WH430> wrestlings <WH5319> I have wrestled <WH6617> with my sister, <WH269> [and] I have indeed <WH1571> prevailed. <WH3201>" And she named <WH7121> <WH8034> him Naphtali. <WH5321>
When Leah <WH3812> saw <WH7200> that she had stopped <WH5975> bearing, <WH3205> she took <WH3947> her maid <WH8198> Zilpah <WH2153> and gave <WH5414> her to Jacob <WH3290> as a wife. <WH802>
And Leah's maid <WH8198> Zilpah <WH2153> bore <WH3205> Jacob <WH3290> a son. <WH1121>
Then Leah <WH3812> said, <WH559> "How fortunate! <WH1409>" So she named <WH7121> <WH8034> him Gad. <WH1410>
And Leah's maid <WH8198> Zilpah <WH2153> bore <WH3205> Jacob <WH3290> a second <WH8145> son. <WH1121>
Then Leah <WH3812> said, <WH559> "Happy <WH837> am I! For women <WH1323> will call <WH7121> me happy. <WH833>" So she named <WH7121> <WH8034> him Asher. <WH836>

Now in the days <WH3117> of wheat <WH2406> harvest <WH7105> Reuben <WH7205> went <WH1980> and found <WH4672> mandrakes <WH1736> in the field, <WH7704> and brought <WH935> them to his mother <WH517> Leah. <WH3812> Then Rachel <WH7354> said <WH559> to Leah, <WH3812> "Please <WH4994> give <WH5414> me some <WH4480> of your son's mandrakes. <WH1736>"

But she said <WH559> to her, "Is it a small <WH4592> matter <WH4592> for you to take <WH3947> my husband <WH376>? And would you take <WH3947> my son's mandrakes <WH1736> also <WH1571>?" So Rachel <WH7354> said, <WH559> "Therefore <WH3651> he may lie <WH7901> with you tonight <WH3915> in return <WH8478> for your son's mandrakes. <WH1736>"

When Jacob <WH3290> came <WH935> in from the field <WH7704> in the evening, <WH6153> then Leah <WH3812> went <WH3318> out to meet <WH7122> him and said, <WH559> "You must come <WH935> in to me, for I have surely <WH7936> hired <WH7936> you with my son's mandrakes. <WH1736>" So he lay <WH7901> with her that night. <WH3915>
And God <WH430> gave <WH8085> heed <WH8085> to Leah, <WH3812> and she conceived <WH2029> and bore <WH3205> Jacob <WH3290> a fifth <WH2549> son. <WH1121>

Then Leah <WH3812> said, <WH559> "God <WH430> has given <WH5414> me my wages, <WH7939> because <WH834> I gave <WH5414> my maid <WH8198> to my husband. <WH376>" So she named <WH7121> <WH8034> him Issachar. <WH3485>
And Leah <WH3812> conceived <WH2029> again <WH5750> and bore <WH3205> a sixth <WH8345> son <WH1121> to Jacob. <WH3290>

Then Leah <WH3812> said, <WH559> "God <WH430> has endowed <WH2064> me with a good <WH2896> gift; <WH2065> now <WH6471> my husband <WH376> will dwell <WH2082> with me, because <WH3588> I have borne <WH3205> him six <WH8337> sons. <WH1121>" So she named <WH7121> <WH8034> him Zebulun. <WH2074>
And afterward <WH310> she bore <WH3205> a daughter <WH1323> and named <WH7121> <WH8034> her Dinah. <WH1783>
Then God <WH430> remembered <WH2142> Rachel, <WH7354> and God <WH430> gave <WH8085> heed <WH8085> to her and opened <WH6605> her womb. <WH7358>
So she conceived <WH2029> and bore <WH3205> a son <WH1121> and said, <WH559> "God <WH430> has taken <WH622> away <WH622> my reproach. <WH2781>"
And she named <WH7121> <WH8034> him Joseph, <WH3130> saying, <WH559> "May the Lord <WH3068> give <WH3254> me another <WH312> son. <WH1121>"

Now it came <WH1961> about when <WH9201> Rachel <WH7354> had borne <WH3205> Joseph, <WH3130> that Jacob <WH3290> said <WH559> to Laban, <WH3837> "Send <WH7971> me away, <WH7971> that I may go <WH1980> to my own place <WH4725> and to my own country. <WH776>

"Give <WH5414> [me] my wives <WH802> and my children <WH3206> for whom <WH834> I have served <WH5647> you, and let me depart; <WH1980> for you yourself <WH859> know <WH3045> my service <WH5656> which <WH834> I have rendered <WH5647> you."

But Laban <WH3837> said <WH559> to him, "If <WH518> now <WH4994> it pleases <WH4672> <WH2580> you, [stay with me;] I have divined <WH5172> that the Lord <WH3068> has blessed <WH1288> me on your account. <WH1558>"
And he continued, <WH559> "Name <WH9344> me your wages, <WH7939> and I will give <WH5414> it."
But he said <WH559> to him, "You yourself <WH859> know <WH3045> how <WH854> <WH834> I have served <WH5647> you and how <WH854> <WH834> your cattle <WH4735> have fared <WH1961> with me.

"For you had <WH1961> little <WH4592> before <WH6440> I came, and it has increased <WH6555> to a multitude; <WH7230> and the Lord <WH3068> has blessed <WH1288> you wherever I turned. <WH7272> But now, <WH6258> when <WH4970> shall I provide <WH6213> for my own household <WH1004> also <WH1571>?"

So he said, <WH559> "What <WH4100> shall I give <WH5414> you?" And Jacob <WH3290> said, <WH559> "You shall not give <WH5414> me anything. <WH3972> If <WH518> you will do <WH6213> this <WH2088> [one] thing <WH1697> for me, I will again <WH7725> pasture <WH7462> [and] keep <WH8104> your flock: <WH6629>

let me pass <WH5674> through your entire <WH3605> flock <WH6629> today, <WH3117> removing <WH5493> from there <WH8033> every <WH3605> speckled <WH5348> and spotted <WH2921> sheep, <WH7716> and every <WH3605> black <WH2345> one <WH7716> among the lambs, <WH3775> and the spotted <WH2921> and speckled <WH5348> among the goats; <WH5795> and [such] shall be my wages. <WH7939>

"So my honesty <WH6666> will answer <WH6030> for me later, <WH4279> <WH3117> when <WH3588> you come <WH935> concerning <WH5921> my wages. <WH7939> Every <WH3605> one <WH3605> that is not speckled <WH5348> and spotted <WH2921> among the goats <WH5795> and black <WH2345> among the lambs, <WH3775> [if found] with me, will be considered stolen. <WH1589>"
And Laban <WH3837> said, <WH559> "Good, <WH2005> let it be according to your word. <WH1697>"

So he removed <WH5493> on that day <WH3117> the striped <WH6124> and spotted <WH2921> male <WH8495> goats <WH8495> and all <WH3605> the speckled <WH5348> and spotted <WH2921> female <WH5795> goats, <WH5795> every <WH3605> one <WH3605> with white <WH3836> in it, and all <WH3605> the black <WH2345> ones <WH2345> among the sheep, <WH3775> and gave <WH5414> them into the care <WH3027> of his sons. <WH1121>
And he put <WH7760> [a distance of] three <WH7969> days' journey <WH1870> between <WH996> himself and Jacob, <WH3290> and Jacob <WH3290> fed <WH7462> the rest <WH3498> of Laban's flocks. <WH6629>

Then Jacob <WH3290> took <WH3947> fresh <WH3892> rods <WH4731> of poplar <WH3839> and almond <WH3869> and plane <WH6196> trees, <WH6196> and peeled <WH6478> white <WH3836> stripes <WH6479> in them, exposing <WH4286> the white <WH3836> which <WH834> [was] in the rods. <WH4731>

And he set <WH3322> the rods <WH4731> which <WH834> he had peeled <WH6478> in front <WH5227> of the flocks <WH6629> in the gutters, <WH7298> [even] in the watering <WH4325> troughs, <WH8268> where <WH834> the flocks <WH6629> came <WH935> to drink; <WH8354> and they mated <WH2552> when they came <WH935> to drink. <WH8354>
So the flocks <WH6629> mated <WH2552> by the rods, <WH4731> and the flocks <WH6629> brought <WH3205> forth <WH3205> striped, <WH6124> speckled, <WH5348> and spotted. <WH2921>

And Jacob <WH3290> separated <WH6504> the lambs, <WH3775> and made <WH5414> the flocks <WH6629> face <WH6440> toward <WH413> the striped <WH6124> and all <WH3605> the black <WH2345> in the flock <WH6629> of Laban; <WH3837> and he put <WH7896> his own herds <WH5739> apart, <WH905> and did not put <WH7896> them with Laban's flock. <WH6629>

Moreover, it came <WH1961> about whenever <WH3605> the stronger <WH7194> of the flock <WH6629> were mating, <WH3179> that Jacob <WH3290> would place <WH7760> the rods <WH4731> in the sight <WH5869> of the flock <WH6629> in the gutters, <WH7298> so that they might mate <WH3179> by the rods; <WH4731>
but when the flock <WH6629> was feeble, <WH5848> he did not put <WH7760> [them] in; so the feebler <WH5848> were Laban's and the stronger <WH7194> Jacob's.

So the man <WH376> became <WH6555> exceedingly <WH3966> prosperous, <WH6555> and had <WH1961> large <WH7227> flocks <WH6629> and female <WH8198> and male <WH5650> servants <WH5650> <WH8198> and camels <WH1581> and donkeys. <WH2543>
